content:
Huh. I wonder why I'm seeing this all of the sudden:

dev_dv_initializer> chown: /dv: I/O error
Context? Reproducer? More log output?
This rather general message can be like a myriad of things... :shrug:
output.txt
Gnrf I hate Zulip for not showing this to me right away. Have to download first. A builtin pastebin thing would be great

Sorry, I was going back and forth about uploading a text file or pasting. There you go ^^
To me this looks like something is wrong on your machine
Disk full?
So my machine crashed yesterday. Then I went home.
Urgh. Can you please delete the volume dirs? There might be some dangling fs thing going on

disk is not full:

Screenshot-2023-11-03-at-10.38.53-AM.png
I already ran rm -rf docker-dev-volumes but I can do it again.
I also ran docker system prune and restarted Docker.
I'm running out of tricks. :sweat_smile:
Sorry but is Docker on Mac using a VM or not?
Good question. Not sure.
I'm trying docker system prune -a
Yes, Docker Desktop does use a Linux VM on Mac
Maybe take a look around if nothing comes up in the management interface? https://gist.github.com/BretFisher/5e1a0c7bcca4c735e716abf62afad389

[snip]
I had to cut off the last few lines. More of the same. tmpfs overlay stuff.
That does not look like something is full...
Can you run a filesystem check?
Both for the VM and for you local filesystem?
What happens if you just start a container e.g. using Alpine, bind mount something and start to chown?
Buh. Maybe. Should I get a new laptop?
Oh the crash wasn't the software it was a FHCE? (Flying Hardware Crash Event)
Yeah, kernel panic or something.
Yikes. Yeah this kind of thing sure can make a filesystem go awry
Can you cook me up an Alpine chown docker compose? It will take me forever. Or give me a one liner?
One sec

/ # cat /etc/issue

Welcome to LinuxKit

                        ##         .
                  ## ## ##        ==
               ## ## ## ## ##    ===
           /"""""""""""""""""\___/ ===
          {                       /  ===-
           \______ O           __/
             \    \         __/
              \____\_______/

my fsck fu is rusty

/ # fsck /
fsck from util-linux 2.34
fsck: error 2 (No such file or directory) while executing fsck.ext2 for /
mkdir -p foobar; docker run -it --rm -v "$(pwd)/foobar:/test" alpine:latest "chown" "1001:1001" "/test"

$ mkdir -p foobar; docker run -it --rm -v "$(pwd)/foobar:/test" alpine:latest "chown" "1001:1001" "/test"
Unable to find image 'alpine:latest' locally
latest: Pulling from library/alpine
96526aa774ef: Already exists
Digest: sha256:eece025e432126ce23f223450a0326fbebde39cdf496a85d8c016293fc851978
Status: Downloaded newer image for alpine:latest
Did it chown proper? (ls -n)

$ ls -nd foobar
drwxr-xr-x@ 2 503  0  64 Nov  3 11:01 foobar
Sorry, not fully understanding what's going on. I'm the slow kid.

Here, how about this? I think the chown worked:

$ mkdir -p foobar; docker run -it --rm -v "$(pwd)/foobar:/test" alpine:latest sh -c "chown 1001:1001 /test; ls -ldn /test"
drwxr-xr-x    2 1001     1001            64 Nov  3 15:01 /test

Here's a chown to a different user (nobody). Also seems to work:

$ mkdir -p foobar; docker run -it --rm -v "$(pwd)/foobar:/test" alpine:latest sh -c "chown 65534:65534 /test; ls -ldn /test"
drwxr-xr-x    2 65534    65534           64 Nov  3 15:01 /test

I clicked "uninstall" Docker Desktop and it's been trying for a long time. 20 minutes? Just a white screen:

Screenshot-2023-11-03-at-12.26.29-PM.png

This gets better and better:

Screenshot-2023-11-03-at-12.48.48-PM.png

I couldn't uninstall Docker. So I downloaded the latest version and installed it. Now I can't even configure it. :disappointed:

Something with network stuff?
"Uninstalling Docker Desktop from the command line is not available. As a workaround, you can uninstall Docker Desktop from the Dashboard." -- https://docs.docker.com/desktop/release-notes/#4250
Via https://github.com/docker/for-mac/issues/6598
I can't even get to the dashboard now. So I can't uninstall.

Error: {"message":"installing vmnetd: retrieving vmnetd version from /Library/LaunchDaemons/com.docker.vmnetd.plist: reading plist /Library/LaunchDaemons/com.docker.vmnetd.plist: open /Library/LaunchDaemons/com.docker.vmnetd.plist: no such file or directory"}
Related: https://stackoverflow.com/questions/76201452/unable-to-finish-docker-install-on-mac-book-error-invoking-remote-method-deskto
And this: https://forums.docker.com/t/mac-m1-install-docker-desktop-error-invoking-remote-method-desktop-go-backend/136495

Ha ha! I was able to get to the uninstall button anyway. And this time it worked! I hope:

Screenshot-2023-11-03-at-1.00.56-PM.png
I rebooted just to be safe. Then installed Docker.
No vmnetd error when doing setup this time.
dev_bootstrap> Done, your instance has been configured for development. Have a nice day!
it works!

Woof, another kernel panic:

kernel.txt
Thankfully, I haven't had another kernel panic. Resolving.
Philip Durbin has marked this topic as resolved.
